content:
15, 2012
												I love this because I love singleplayer experience gameplay that allows you to roam around with whatever equipment you want. There's a good mix of freedom, side missions, and storyline missions that you have to complete to progress. You can always go backwards, hunt for things, sell your treasures, and buy weapons and ammo untill the endgame. The endgame itself is long and multi-choice, taking me totally by surprise at how epic it turned out to be. I was completely satisfied with it seeing how such a modest game could unmask itself as being so brilliant. I wish I'd played it sooner and had higher expectations with it, or I might never have tried it out. If you enjoy this and want a multiplayer version, I think DayZ mod for Arma 2 feels quite similar.

content:
14, 2014
												S.T.A.L.K.E.R. is a great game. One of my favorites. I've been told modding it makes it the most fun, but I haven't done that yet.STALKER is has some bugs, silly voice acting (some characters only have one line and will repeat it every time you come into view: google "Get out of here stalker", or "I said come in, don't stand there"), but overall it's a great game.Similiarities and differences: STALKER is most similar to Metro: 2033, probably because they are some of the same people who made it. It is not very similar to Fallout 3, other than the large world (Fallout 3 is much larger) but there is no level system, no experience points. Just reputation with factions, which basically means "Did you kill any Duty members? Did you kill any Freedom members?" since these are the only real factions in the game which don't initially hate you.Mechanics: S.T.A.L.K.E.R. is an exploration based game, if I had to call it something. The world is filled with anomalies that hurt you as you stand near. Throwing a bolt in the direction of one will activate it, showing you where it is. Expensive "artifacts" will fall out of them sometimes, and they will have various effects on your character. For instance, there is one that increases health regeneration but decreases bullet defense, and all other defense. It is terrible. There is also my favorite, Moonlight, which increases Endurance and decreases electrical defense.Endurance is the system of sprinting, carrying things, etc. If you are over-encumbered, and you walk places, your endurance will slowly go down. If you sprint, it will instantly go down. Having an endurance boosting artifact is one of the best things in the game because it gives endless sprinting when below 50 KG and longer sprinting above that. You cannot carry very much and must be very careful with inventory management. Side-missions will reward artifacts and special weaponry. They have a time limit. One set of side missions unlocks the "true" ending, you should save multiple times in the end of the game to ensure you get that, and look up how to unlock these side missions before going into Chernobyl. The storyline has you going from different areas into the game, until you get to the top of Army Warehouses, which is the end-game area. The shooting mechanics are very nice. Everyone, including you, has low health. Guns are inaccurate, damaging, and have bullet drop. Headshots are very powerful and can lead to a quick death, which makes this game hard for you too. There are many different guns and armors, many different bullet types. Rifles, Grenade Revolvers, Handguns, SMGs, shotguns, gauss gun, rocket launcher, sniper rifles. You can equip one major weapon and one pistol at the same time. To switch them out, you need to go into inventory. I love this game and it has a great open-world exploration aspect of it. Anomalies, bandits, mutants, and monolith are your enemies and the zone watches your fights.

er 16, 2014
												The king of suspense and post apocalypse genre. Granted its not exactly post apocalypse since the world has not been destroyed just...Chernobyl but thats beside the point since the game still gives of that feeling. Now to the game itself. It doesn't hold your hand right from the start and you can easily die on the first mission if you don't plan properly. Firefights are not a walk in the park and you need to be very careful unless you like reloading saves since you didn't notice the guy hiding behind the car. This game also allows the player to customize their loadout and make sure they have enough healthkits and food for when its needed...as well as vodka since it can remove radiation...apparently. Now everything wants to kill you in the game including the environment. Ontop of this be prepared to ♥♥♥♥ your pants since this game does horror well. You can go through 6 rooms in a building and then as you are leaving you hear a noise and well...something bad is in the building with you and it wants to meet you.To sum up, it a game which you will love if you enjoy a challange, a time sink, amazing enviroments and the genre itself.

content:
y 16, 2016
												S.T.A.L.K.E.R Shadow of Chernobyl is an elder russian game which is a post-apocalyptic, "open-world"-ish FPS game. (no this is not a fallout wannabe, even though at first glance it seems to be)This game it not perfect, nor that beautiful, and there are bugs and errors.But why am I then recommending this game? 'cause nothing is perfect, young padawan.The quality of the game gets highly increased if you mod the game, I did only play with weight mods, so I can bear a ton XD but there are lots of other quite interesting mods out there.Lets firstly take the "killers" of this game.- The game can crash a lot for some people, for me it was a very few times, there can be weird errors here and there but nothing that can't be fixed either with a reload, restart or just by ignoring it.- It is an old game, it is from 2007, so the grafic is only okay, not ugly but not pretty, and it is a russian game, I am not against russians gamedevelopers, they have created truly unique games like the stalker franchies, the hard truck apocalypse franchies and lots more. But it is wellknown that there can be a lot of bugs, luckily this one only has a few.- Better agrosystem. You can, if you snipe friendly target, kill them and if killed by one shot, you will therefore not be attracting agro to you, therefore you can kill all of your allies and loot them if you want to and still be ally with their fraction.- without any doubt there is missing a little bit of more detailed landscaping, more weapons, maybe a little more work on the plot and other small things. (not that the game is missing a lot on these things) Then there is the sunshines of this game- If you like a game which you can set to a hard difficulty, then this game is for you. You cannot be rambo in this game, not on higher difficulty, and if you choose to remove your sight of your weapon, then it gets a hell lot more fun(this game prepared me for killing floor to shoot without a weaponsight)- The atmosphere.... uuuhhh that is the one reason I really love this franchies, it has really caught this dark, lonely, chaotic and sometimes horrifying post apocalyptic atmosphere. It is not a game which "romantice" the post apocalyptic setting which many other post apocalyptic games do(not that it is bad, but it is great to get this realistic, "autentic" post apocalyptic atmosphere"- interesting monsters, they have been quite creative with some of their monsters, especially some of the rare ones did frighten the ♥♥♥♥ out of me when I encountered them for the first time, especially the one which could affect your mind.- multiply endings! I didn't know this before I read about it, but this game has different endings! Of course now many games now at days, even FPS games, have different endings, but for me it is really a plus especially when this is an old game :) - Interesting univers/world/setting, lore and plot. Even though the plot wasn't the best in the world, there was still enough of mystery to this setting, that you wanted to explore more. - I love the real russian feel of the setting, because you really felt that you are in chernobyl because  the dialouge is in english with a heavy lovely Russian accent, then the NPCs talked russian to one another while you are walking by. But I have to say, I am a big sucker for the Russian language. :P so that is why I have this as a proSo yeah is this game better than fallout? No, especially not this one which is the first one in this franchies, go look for the newer installments, they are a lot better than this one. But if you have been playing through all fallout games and still crave for a postapocalyptic world, then this series brings another perspective and alternative setting(because it is not the whole world, only the closed world of chernobyl which are the setting)And yeah it is recommended to mod it(just like fallout) :)

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
er 24, 2012
												Talk about a game with immersion - Having played S.T.A.L.K.E.R. SOC on retail disk countless times and then regretably selling it, I jumped at the chance to pick up the Steam version cheap on Ebay.You play as the "Marked One" and your travels will take you across the vast wasteland of the Zone near the Chernobyl NCP in the Ukraine.  This open ended blended RPG FPS will keep you plenty occupied with enough playtime to log countless hours.  There are a number of quests and side missions to partake in or just venture the Zone and kill mutants and search for artifiacts if you please - this i what I do sometimes to kill time and play around in the world.. just to enjoy its menacing atmosphere.The immersion and atmosphere is deliciuosly unique and the Stalker series is my fav regarding a creepy feeling.  I use the "Complete" mod available at artistpavel.com and it intensifies the atmosFEAR and graphics as well as does a complete overhaul of the game for a more stable experience.  Real time weather and day/night cycles are a treat to behold.  Sound and Music is great with eerie/spooky ambience throughout, gun effects are realistic.The graphics look stunning for portraying the grislt world of the zone which is a treacherous, darkly beautiful radioactive wasteland.  For as big as the game is the world looks fantastic and considering its a few years old.This is a hard game (my opionion) and I think is designed toward a more die hard PC player - it is not run and gun - you will die plenty.  The A.I. is tuff and smart - dodge and cover is there motto.   The first time you encounter a controller watch out - one of my favorite enemies ever.  Nearly half my friends list already has this gem, so they know a great game when they see it.Good hunting Stalker.  ✔Recommended

This game will rock your socks and pack an amazing graphical package even for a game made in 2007! This game was groundbreaking in it's time, and it's hard to believe (Okay, well, except for engine bugs. it's not like source.) It's an old game. First in the series, i'd reccomend you to get this game first in the series. As any other part of the game wouldn't make sense. And, with mods, this game will have you coming back for more and more. (and more!) [EDIT: MODS SHOULD ONLY BE APPLIED AFTER PLAYING THROUGH THE 'VANILLA' UNMODDED STORYLINE A MINIMAL TIME OF ONCE. TRY VANILLA BEFORE SPRINKLES.] This game's really quite better than the other two, in my opinion. Please, If you like fallout NV and are a bit upset with how 4 turned out, Try this game, at least once. If you don't like it, you can complain to me. But I bet you'll like it for one reason or another.EDIT:I have racked up over 600 hours of this game, (12/2/13) making it nearly surpass my most played game (Mabinogi, 1500+hrs) in at least half the time. (~4 years? yikes.)I can COMFORTABLY SAY that this game does NOT get old despite the linear story, if you ignore that and make your own storyline out of it, jee wilikers, it can get intense. personally my most reccomended game ever wowie zowie.n if eny of u fukz wana sey it 'lookz b@d', u guyz dun cumplein boot fullout's werd chererter desiens, u laff at it. u shuld do det wifh stukler

												I killed my first bandit, looted him, ate the bread he had, and made my game crash 10/10But for real this game is amazing and unforgiving. I played the whole game on the easiest difficulty, "Novice" I think it was called and it was still challenging.My word of advice is to get the Vintar sniper rifle in the base of this faction called "Freedom" which is located in the Military Warehouses area. The Vintar is probably my most favorite weapon in the game.I say the game is unforgiving because I made a quicksave in the CNPP (Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant) and kept dying of radiation, going back to the quicksave, and dying of radiation again, and repeat. That was entirely my fault for not bringing enough anti-radiation and medical supplies with me.All enemies do pose a challenge, at least until you get a really good weapon or two, then some of the enemies become easier to kill. The enemies you fight can be easy peasy bandits, challenging military, or deadly mutants that can kill you almost instantly.You can find these artifacts that help you out on your adventures in The Zone (Chernobyl Exclusion Zone) which give you enhancements. For example, you can get a artifact that increases your resistance to bullet damage but makes you more radioactive slightly. These artifacts can fetch a good price to traders so you can make some money in your pocket which you can use to buy guns, ammunition, armor, medical supplies, food, and more from traders.I'll stop the review right here because I don't know what the hell else to talk about. This game is a solid 10/10 for me.

3, 2016
												Probably one of my favorite games on PC, Shadow of Chernobyl will keep you playing for hours on end. its awesomePROS:-Great Atmosphere- lots to explore- pretty in depth weapon system for a game from 2007- great graphics for its time- runs great on computers that arent even meant for gaming at decent settings- Difficult parts are still funCONS:- The weapons at the start of the game are pretty inaccurate, even when ADS, but i think this was a design choice- Pretty weird complaint but you cant open the steam menu(shift+tab) so you cant respond to messages9/10 definitley reccommend this game, especially if you catch it during a sale where you can get all three games for $10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
er 23, 2016
												The pinnacle of first person shooters if you ask me.+High replayability, gets better in every consecutive replay in some aspects+Mods, mods, mods, mods, mods, mods, mods, mods, mods+Highly immersive atmosphere+No hand holding+Only loss condition is your own death+Progression through obtaining better equipment, guns, armor and artifacts+Weapon and ammo variety, weapons handle nicely with semi-realistic physics, there is little more satisfying than seeing your bullet go downrange and pop a Monolyth's head at long range+чики брики+Spooky labs and tunnels+Challenging AI-Bugs, crashes, some easily removable with community fixes, others not so much-The hobo stage can be off-putting for a first time player-Some hints at features that ended up being removed (can somewhat be re-added with mods)Will update as I feel like it.

content:
r 14, 2015
												I wanted to write a review a long time ago, but didn't know what to say, here it goes.This is a great game with a beautiful, well developed story and realistic at the same time, it is based on a real life disaster which occured in 1986, in the nuclear reactor Chernobyl, close to the city of Pripyat. Only lack i find here is the lack of multiplayer, since i think this would go great in multiplayer, however it is bearable since it's a 2007 game, when gaming wasn't so full of multiplayer. I was always attracted to these types of games, so i might exaggarate. I just have 11 hours so far but i'm ready to go deeper into it, now i need to go to the lab X18 which is known to be the most scary, it's night time so i'm at the bar preparing for the day, another thing is a lack of skipping a night, this is my 2nd night, and i need to wait, it's around 0.5h. You see all these games about surviving in a post apocalyptic world, like DayZ, well, stalker started it, and it started well. One of the things i find priceless is sitting around the fire or at the bar and enjoying with fellow NPC stalkers, too bad it's only NPCs. Anyways, if you are looking for a good game, this is for you. 8/10.

content:
r 31, 2016
												a really great game. Dated a little engine wise, but it doesn't hurt the experience.I liked clear sky's play through better. It's more difficult and has a more "survival" feel to it. This is a bit more guided but that makes it better for "new" to the series.  Prypiyat's engine is more refined, and visually more appealing. I like it's weapons systems the best.This game will really get you into it however. There is a lot here more modern games should learn. Weapon wear and tear, cost of even getting grazed (you have to replace or repair everything) value of what to carry, and a very good creepy, real world run down look.with modern pricing it's a steal. One doesn't even need to "play" this serious to "win" just explore. It's one of those games you can enjoy just hunting around in the wilds and seeing what's out there. I suggest it to anyone who likes RPG's OR FPS games. The stalker series has a certain charm to it many games just lack. It affects your soul a little. The visuals are very close to the real world, even with game limitations of the various engines. This gives you a scenery effect. It's similar to games like far cry 2 where one finds themselves climbing a spot just to see a sunrise, or hiking to an area just to see the way the sunand the fog dance across the valley.the emersion factor of the stalker series can and will change you as person if you let it.  It can remind you a lot about what is important in life, by reminding you to just look around you, see whats out there, and not try to "Win" as much as "experience" things.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
9, 2015
 S.T.A.L.K.E.R.:Shadow of Chernobyl  If you are looking for a game that holds your hand a babies you with autosaves and an easy difficulty you will not find it here. Now, I am one who started off with Call of Pripyat and jumping to this game I was a bit dissapointed by the very barebones system of game mechanics but with the instalation of a mod, I managed to really get into the universe.The world is terrifying. There are few games that scare me but are so alluring at the same time.This game got everything right about a nuclear wasteland in a very stylized and brutal way.First off, let me tell you reasons  why you should buy it.  Immersive and terrifying game world Unforgiving and hardcore gameplay Interesting universe full of lore Challenging gunplay AN-94 Difficult AI opponents Unique theme, Chernobyl is loads of fun to explore A large variety of enemies A unique survival expirience Convincing atmosphere Beautiful, creepy, and immersive sound design Large modding community that includes additional storylines/ areasNow here are some of the reasons  I might not suggest this game.  Loads of bugs Clunky movement system Poor balance, I had to install a mod for the game to be playable. (S.T.A.L.K.E.R. Complete 2009) Very badly dated athstetics Weak/Almost non exsistant story Dissapointing/Unfulfilling ending "Open world" is divided into VERY small areas Built on the most offensively terrible game engine I have ever played a game on At 8 years old has aged severly Anomalies are EVERYWHERE killing you almost instantly setting you back to your last save (SO SAVE CONSTANTLY)The ending of this game throws any fraction of balance there may have been out of the window. I was expecting so much more from the end of the game and all it ended up being was a frustrating shooting gallery, with no final boss fight. I was expecting far far more from this game coming from Call of Pripyat. If you have finished this game you know exactly what I am talking about, not to mention the fact that when you beat the game with that terrible ending, thats it. No more exploration. No selling your mad loot for an epic weapon. Nothing.The game just send and gives you the chance to replay the ending again. Thats it.Now S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2 was supposed to be the game to make up for all of this, but sadly it was killed off just like the staff of the nuclear reactor after the melt down.The game also has a surprising lack of mutants. That was supposed to me the main horror factor of this game but they stopped showing up to the part about half way through leaving me feeling a little unsatisfied.There was only a hand full of times this game really had me scared, and they were short lived. Would I reccomend this game? If you are willing to install a mod or two and overlook all the cons this game has then it is for sure a yes from me.But only if the good things I listed really interests you.If this game does not really grab your attention, then I would reccomend for $20 you hold off on this one. If you are not all that interested than you really aren't going to miss out.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
8, 2014
												In my opinion, this is one of the all time greats of PC gaming; a true work of genius.  Not only is it a fantastic horror-themed game, but it also sports one of the best gun-based combat engines I've ever used in any game.  But I think what I like the best about the game are the incredible atmospherics.  Between the vast swaths of abandoned structures that you can explore, and the wonderful dynamic weather system, Stalker is a game that truly and deeply immerses you in a terrifying alternate reality.  Truly, I cannot say enough about this bona fide classic.  PS:  And don't let its age scare you away.  Get the easy to install Stalker Complete mod, and this game looks and runs just fine on a modern rig.  Also, be sure to read Roadside Picnic, and watch the movie Stalker, for a better idea of the origins of the Zone.

												The pinnacle of first person shooters if you ask me.+High replayability, gets better in every consecutive replay in some aspects+Mods, mods, mods, mods, mods, mods, mods, mods, mods+Highly immersive atmosphere+No hand holding+Only loss condition is your own death+Progression through obtaining better equipment, guns, armor and artifacts+Weapon and ammo variety, weapons handle nicely with semi-realistic physics, there is little more satisfying than seeing your bullet go downrange and pop a Monolyth's head at long range+чики брики+Spooky labs and tunnels+Challenging AI-Bugs, crashes, some easily removable with community fixes, others not so much-The hobo stage can be off-putting for a first time player-Some hints at features that ended up being removed (can somewhat be re-added with mods)Will update as I feel like it.

Product received for free
												S.T.A.L.K.E.R Shadow of Chernobyl was released in 2007, after almost 5-6 years of development. The game storyline begins with an introductionary video which gives a tiny back of backstory about how you end up in the bunker of the local trader. Your first tasks will be very easy, and as you progress into the storyline, they will get increasingly harder to complete. The game also offers side quests which you may or may not complete, depending on your own will. The game got few endings, which I won't spoil, thats for you to find out. The game features several medium sized levels which you can explore with no limitations (unless you get to the end of the level). Graphically speaking, the game doesn't look bad nowadays, with the exception of the models, which can be easily fixed using mods created by the community.

er 7, 2016
												S.T.A.L.K.E.R. has an amazing atmosphere due to the gorgeous environment and the perfectly executed post-apocalyptic feel. It's a game that definitely has some flaws, particularly when it comes to the quest and mapping systems, but I forgave all of them because I was so invested, and having so much fun. I liked the difficulty too (be warned, inexperienced shooters will get owned often), as it added a level of realism to match the gritty world the player finds themselves in. I really enjoyed the 20 hours it took to complete, and recommend this first S.T.A.L.K.E.R. game wholeheartedly. I look forward to seeing what the other games in the series have in store for me.

content:
4, 2016
												This game is an enigma for me. Russian 'end of the world' stories all seem to revolve around 'bombs drop, we all die... yet we don't all die. Mutants attack, weird anomolys pop up... we have to survive in this nightmare.' Now in this game it's not the end of the world, only the area around Chernobyl.The game is rife with interesting options for ways to kill people. There are some systems in the game that don't really effect gameplay as much as you'd expect (factions for instance... you can pretty much fight whomever you want/can kill... instead of spending weeks farming faction lol). Stealth is by far better rewarded than in most games, but you can still take the 'RAMBO MUTHA F*(&&*%*&%ERS!' approach, but be prepared to get lit up if you are outgunned. The mutants are pretty interested and surprising, and the anomolies can really make the landscape alive... in more ways than one.There is some minor RPG elements with the way gear works, but honestly once you get the hang of it you can pretty much get your hero up to insane levels of power and plow through targets with little effort, just have to spend time getting the right rocks... so to speak.Graphically the game is a bit dated, but the gameplay holds up. If you want a nice open world feel for a nightmare... by all means get this game. If you get stuck (Learning curve can be a bit rough) look up one of the hundreds of guides out there to give you a hand.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
15, 2015
												1st person, open world, apocalyptic action shooter with RPG, fiction and horror elements. It's the 2nd game in timeline, following soon after the events of S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky. This is the original S.T.A.L.K.E.R. and first game in the series, about zone that surrounds 30km around destroyed nuclear power plant. Aftermath of tragedy at Chernobyl power plant (Ukraine USSR) that took place in 1986, when one of nuclear reactors in Chernobyl nuclear power plant exploded, releasing big quantities of radiation and contaminating large area around the plant and nearby town of Pripyat. Developers took this true and gruesome story, added fiction and horror elements from the S.T.A.L.K.E.R. books, to make a unique and atmospheric 1st person action shooter experience.Story takes place long after the events of 1986, now it's 2012 and zone around Chernobyl is nothing like it was before. In year 2006, there was 2nd reactor explosion (fiction) that expanded the zone and sent waves of energy and radiation outwards, killing every living being in the area. Only military personal and scientists were allowed to enter the zone. Even though military closed all the entrances and fenced down 30km area around the power plant, despite the dangers people started to venture inside the zone, exploring unknown areas, discovering new anomalies, artifacts and creatures within. Later those brave yet outlaw individuals were called Stalkers.Though your story in beginning of the game is unclear, because you are suffering from some sort of amnesia, you must uncover the events that took place before you awoke on Sidorovich's table, with strange tattoo on your arm and single objective in your "Personal digital assistant" (PDA), to kill someone called Strelok.Game has open word imitation with many large, open yet fenced areas to explore, as well as indoor and underground levels. All areas have checkpoints between them, and going through one will load the next area connected to it. You can easily check map, objectives, statistics about yourself and much more in your PDA. Many areas in game are radioactive and hazardous, some filled with anomalies that are dangerous and hard to notice, so make sure you always listen to your "beeping" Detector (no puns intended) to quickly leave the dangerous area.As well as invisible hazards there are plenty of dangers that you can see, one of those are mutants (creatures, animals, people that were exposed to large amounts of radiation, and through many generations mutated more and more), some previously were wild animals or livestock, others are heavily mutated humanoids. All of them are very resistant to radiation and many in game hazards, which explains how they survived the 2nd reactor explosion in 2006.One of many ways to protect yourself from hazards is wearing suits made by Stalkers, they range from simple clothing with simple weather protection; one piece body suits with rebreathers to armor with chest kevlar plates and radiation reflective layers, to protect you from many types of harm. As well as gear, there are many medications that can save your life: few kinds of medikits, bandages, anti radiation drugs and injections. Some basic survival equipment includes: knife, binoculars, food (sausage, bread, canned food, energy drinks and vodka which is ideal to reduce radiation exposure).Main source of income in game are artifacts. Usually found near anomalies and secret stashes where Stalkers and other people hide their valuables, around the world. There are many different kinds of artifacts, each with their own unique look, statistics and value. Most artifacts will give you useful "buffs" but also expose you with radiation, others absorb radiation or add positive effects, so mix and match to get the best symbiosis, or simply drink more vodka / anti radiation drugs if your radiation exposure is reaching high levels.There are many kinds of weapons in game. Different kinds of pistols, sub machine guns, shotguns, assault rifles, machine guns, sniper rifles and grenades. As well as some futuristic weapons I wont mention to not spoil the game. You can put scopes, silencers, grenade launcher modifications on some weapons. There are few bullet types for each weapon, as well as many bullet calibers. You can't modify or repair armor and weapons like you can in S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky, so I would suggest to get mods for that if you really want to. Game has working ballistics system, so bullets fly in arc and will ricochet from surfaces.Game has few factions and depending on your actions, you can be either hostile, neutral or friendly with them. Hostile reputation will not benefit you in any way, neutral will grant you the ability to speak and trade with them and friendly will open up some side missions, discounts and chance to join said faction. Best game for faction play is S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky. Just wanted to add, even though game has many difference types of NPC roles, there are no female nurses, cooks or any females whatsoever. Developers decided not to include those because of harsh world and nature of players, go figure.To close it off will say that game is somewhat aged and may not look that appealing to many players. But what game lacks, it compensates with atmosphere, grim feel, gameplay and story. It has working day and night cycle, life simulation for NPC and decent AI. Game will not hold your hand, and is challenging on harder difficulties if you don't take cover behind something. Voice acting is a bit basic but only if you play with English language, it's just a bit weird with the accents. I experienced minor graphics glitches concerning lighting and shadows, as well as many xrCore.dll relates crashes without modifications, but maybe it's just on my end.Other than that game is fun, with tension and scare moments once in a while. Try this out, and better yet get all 3 games and play them in this order: S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Clear Sky, S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl, S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat for the best story experience.P.S. Don't forget your anti radiation sun cream, it's not often but occasionally you can see sun in between rain and thunderstorms.

content:

												I feel as if I should do a pro/con review.PROS:-Free roam-a decent variety of weapons ranging from a knife, to a PM Makarov (a small pistol), to more advanced assault rifles, to mutant destroying shotguns, to rocket propelled grenade launchers (only necessary for the BTR at the near end of the game, and if you are too lazy to bind controls to lean from a wall when fighting one of the few Controllers), to a gauss rifle-The AKS-74-Nice firing sounds (except for the PM Makarov, that sound is ugly)-Cheeki Breeki-Lots of mods-Can be spooky (not scary, spooky) when in the underground labsCONS:-It's from 2007 and costs $19.99-The first person animations can be quite distasteful to some people-The XRay engine can crash sometimes (I've only experienced crashes when I used mods, somehow I played the vanilla game crash and bug free.-The devs misspelled barrel and grenades as "barrell & granades"-I don't have a good enough computer to play with a high grass density or anything above static lighting-The M9 pistol doesn't have glow in the dark night sights on Objects Dynamic Lighting or Full Dynamic Lighting-There is only one M9 in the default/vanilla game and it wears out too fast-The XM8, P90, and any Glocks are non-existant in The Zone-Cheeki Breeki can only be heard from bandits, and they always try to kill you-They patched the "Get out of here S.T.A.L.K.E.R." guy so he only says it a few times instead of repeating it constantly until you actually get out of the room he is in-The multiplayer portion doesn't really have that much players online-They cut the Browning HP out of the game, you can get it back, it's just really powerful-I managed to insert more cons than pros

content:
1, 2015
												This is a copy of my metracritic review (I gave 10 out of 10):This game is a fps with a small rpg element and takes place in the 'Zone' around Chernobyl where you have to do missions to progress in the story.The opinion of this game is often black or white: many people love it while others hate it. In the beginning it took me also hours before I could understand the concept. I almost abandoned it before I started to like and love it. The graphics are ok but the atmosphere (e.g. weather, sounds, lighting in caves) is extraordinary. A good example is the first underground mission in Agroprom, which is spooky as hell. Some drawbacks are bugs and crashes, lack of transportation, difficult shooting (i.e. aim for the head and be prepared to get killed with 1 shot) and learning curve in the beginning.Despite its flaws I consider this is as the best game of the past 10 year.

content:
1, 2014
												I absolutely adore this game. For whatever reason it was one of my earliest Steam purchases, and really set a precedent for me. I'm probably one of the few people left that plays this game without mods/vanilla, and I'm always hesitant to install them. This game was my Dark Souls many years earlier. It is brutal and unforgiving and really takes an understanding of what is happening around you so that you can eventually feel like you are actually a powerful force in the world you inhabit and deserve to be as such. Hauntingly beatiful and deathly terrifying, I'd recommend this game to anyone who enjoys difficult atmospheric shooters (think early Metro 2033/Last Light with more outdoors settings). It has been a long time since I've had to learn and pay attention as much in a game as in this one, and I'll forever revel in it as it holds a special place in my heart. The following games advance in different directions but still afford notice, I've only played its prequel and not the sequel so I can't make particular recommendations there. If you like what you've heard here, and want to pick up an extremely interesting game that it would be hard to spend more than $20 on, heed my advice and go for it8/10

												It's S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl and it's one of the best first person shooters of all time. This game has it all with the rough characters that are earthy and simple, the huge amount of inventory that's available and of course don't bring back everything you can to the trader for extra cash because you're simply going to have a huge pile of gear in the ship or near your locker and then the game slows down because you brought back thousands of extra handguns, knives, ammo and whatever and then tossed them in the corner. If you do that then spread them around outside because the game get's unstable with thousands of weapons and stuff tossed in the corner of a room. Trust me you don't want to do that because the game doesn't like it but otherwise this game is solid, fun, kewl, awesome and it gets very creepy, moody, spooky and full of pressure and tight suspense. There's a lot to risk and a lot to think about and the more you play the more you want to play more. This game needs the mods from MODdb and after that you're set and ready to play. The MODS there will stabilize the game, tweak the graphics, add some gear and make everything operate better and more stable. Buy it because it's sooper and buy S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat too because it' simply awesome too. The other STALKER Clear Sky I've not played much and it seems different and so I didn't find the extra time because I have 48 shooter games ;) Buy S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat and buy S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl because these are the best in the series and both have great support at MODdb and you'll love the trippy weirdness of the game that is 100% a full on first person shooter experience with some really kewl other stuff to do too. Great games.

												This game isn't for everyone, a quirky FPS with great atmosphere and a unique setting (it's probably been done to death since then, but this game was the first). I re-installed it at least 3 times over the past 5-6 years to play through it again, originally i had a boxed copy and i bought the steam version when i couldnt find it anymore. So there you go, once you get into it it's pretty darn good.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
y 11, 2014
												Stalker, first and foremost is an older game at this time, Hailing from 2007, this game can easily be played to its full graphical potential on even the lower end gaming computers, as it runs near flawlessly on mine. The combat is as fluent throughout the game, as it is realistic. Your character will succumb after only a few hits or shots, even on the "normal" difficulty or, "Stalker". (Novice, Stalker, Veteran, Master) Scavenging for items is nice, searching dead bodies and even being able to drag them as to not alert others, weapons perform realisticly as one cannot pull headshots with pistols or shotguns no problem, and the recoil and reload animations are very nice. Theres a trading system also, which allows practically any friendly person to be a potential purveyor of goods ranging from food, weapons, ammo, and other various necessary gear items, allowing yoiu to trade off found weapons and such or even buy new ones with the money provided, It is first person, has a nice open world feel to it as you can accomplish objectives and side missons from however angle you please, but also requires the patience of a saint to play. Ive died an innumerable amount of times in the first two hours of gameplay, being too gung-ho or  trying to be that guy that rambos the entire russian federation. plus these "anomalies" encountered are THE biggest pain. imagine an invisable enemy that you cant kill. that just repeatedly attacks you when you get in its proximity. this is "fixed" by providing the player with not only the ability to see the dust these things kick up, but an infinite amount of bolts that youre just lugging around. This game, all in all, is solid and promising. i do hope to enjoy it.PROS-Realism of firefights, weapon handling, and environment-creepy as hell creatures, mutants and such-plenty of weapons/gear-sound effects are nice-still eye pleasing even after all this time-Weather/time of day changes(think, Metro 2033/Fallout before they were big)CONS-Dead bodies too ragdoll-y at times-frustrating "trial and error" combat-no auto save...?-even the normal difficulty is still hard-controls are a bit fumbly

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
y 25, 2015
												When someone asks "which is the best FPS you've ever played?" It's a difficult question to answer, but I can easily that STALKER SOC is the best FPS I've played in the last 10 years. The RPG elements, inventory management and the sandbox environment add a lot of depth to the game and the atmosphere is just brilliant. The exclusion zone is beautifully created and the bleak atmosphere is captured well. There are plenty of weapons, not weapons different because of stats but different unique weapons that can be modified with a scope or a grenade launcher. Artifacts can be collected and used for additional stats like protection against radation or bullets.      "You kill two blood suckers and your health is down and the screen stars to swim and that moment of dread when you realise that a controller is nearby!" that's horror!      I'm playing the Pripyat mission in the night looking for the secret lab and it was so brilliant that I had to pause the game and come here to write a review. Please, I mean PLEASE do yourself a favor and pick this game up!!!!!!!!!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
1, 2015
												This is a copy of my metracritic review (I gave 10 out of 10):This game is a fps with a small rpg element and takes place in the 'Zone' around Chernobyl where you have to do missions to progress in the story.The opinion of this game is often black or white: many people love it while others hate it. In the beginning it took me also hours before I could understand the concept. I almost abandoned it before I started to like and love it. The graphics are ok but the atmosphere (e.g. weather, sounds, lighting in caves) is extraordinary. A good example is the first underground mission in Agroprom, which is spooky as hell. Some drawbacks are bugs and crashes, lack of transportation, difficult shooting (i.e. aim for the head and be prepared to get killed with 1 shot) and learning curve in the beginning.Despite its flaws I consider this is as the best game of the past 10 year.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
10, 2014
												I feel as if I should do a pro/con review.PROS:-Free roam-a decent variety of weapons ranging from a knife, to a PM Makarov (a small pistol), to more advanced assault rifles, to mutant destroying shotguns, to rocket propelled grenade launchers (only necessary for the BTR at the near end of the game, and if you are too lazy to bind controls to lean from a wall when fighting one of the few Controllers), to a gauss rifle-The AKS-74-Nice firing sounds (except for the PM Makarov, that sound is ugly)-Cheeki Breeki-Lots of mods-Can be spooky (not scary, spooky) when in the underground labsCONS:-It's from 2007 and costs $19.99-The first person animations can be quite distasteful to some people-The XRay engine can crash sometimes (I've only experienced crashes when I used mods, somehow I played the vanilla game crash and bug free.-The devs misspelled barrel and grenades as "barrell & granades"-I don't have a good enough computer to play with a high grass density or anything above static lighting-The M9 pistol doesn't have glow in the dark night sights on Objects Dynamic Lighting or Full Dynamic Lighting-There is only one M9 in the default/vanilla game and it wears out too fast-The XM8, P90, and any Glocks are non-existant in The Zone-Cheeki Breeki can only be heard from bandits, and they always try to kill you-They patched the "Get out of here S.T.A.L.K.E.R." guy so he only says it a few times instead of repeating it constantly until you actually get out of the room he is in-The multiplayer portion doesn't really have that much players online-They cut the Browning HP out of the game, you can get it back, it's just really powerful-I managed to insert more cons than pros

												Pros-------+Good starter game.  +Plenty of mods and workshop items to increase playability.+Immersive story.+AtmosphericCons-------somewhat tough learning curve-unmodded graphics look a bit dated-Realistic ballistics can be difficult for recreational fps gamersAll in all, a great sandbox game. number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
6, 2016
												Traverse through the plains of The Zone, ruptured by the asteroid Monolith, through a journey to the North in Europe.Reviews:Music: shivers through my soul, with most of them in slow-paced nightmarish feels.Enemies: very expert in flanking, too limited in camping their prefered zone, does not use grenades....Interactives/elements: moderate at its old age, but interesting especially equipments, enemies, and creative characteristic stats such as resistance and statuses.Horror: probably the main selling point, varying from human enemies backstabbing you at most times, to *many different* invisible psychic mutants stalking their prey, to supernatural anomalies that creates brutal destructions.Plot: its in hybrid language but each endings pretty much covered how much you've done in the game.Game engines: smooth for low-spec users, non-demanding graphic but on-point atmosphere specially in-door. Slightly laggy multiplayer (Well yeah you're playing with europeans what chu expect)Critics:-after knowing enemies's mechanism or certain area's progression, you'd feel kinda empty, having new encounter in this game fills that selling point up good.-no backtrack allowed-stumpy interface like Maps and quest track-hybrid sandbox-linear mapping progression-slightly glitchy (probably for amusement)-potential in creating mutant bosses..8/10 a nightmare that I don't want to restart again, WHERE THE ♥♥♥♥ IS THAT NYAN COMING FROM?! Get its bundle when its cheap

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
ry 23, 2016
												Lets get some things out of the way -this game is not a twich shooter its gunplay is more similar to arma than CoD (which may be a dealbreaker for some)-you are slow and lumbering plus the lack of fast travel makes going back and forth between quests somewhat boring and monotonous -without spoiling anything the ending came out of nowhere (I was halfway expecting to be pulled back into the game after the credits)-there is no skills progression and base level weapons are still effective at end game if used properly -there are odd difficulty spikes when the rng nature of openents weapons and equipment rolls against you -game is not fully voiced in english (understandable given its Ukrainian developers-enemy AI has dificulty tracking moving targets (you can really hit them while running so its not game breaking)-you will die... alot (F6 quicksave F7 load last save)with those points out of the way I would like to say why I recomend this game-the skill based gunplay feels intuitive and fun -game is dufficult and unforgiving but fair-game builds up tension like nothing youve ever seen due to its fantastic lighting and sound design -I like to think of myself as being hard to scare but this game manages to -HEADSOTS ARE INSAKILL (for you and enemy keep that in mind when your questioning why you got oneshoted)-interesting faction and npc relationship system with every npc in game (shoot out a bandits legs but let him live and that same guy might save you in the future unless he gets eaten by wild dogs)-game will let you fail quests (essential ones will have to be completed some other way(branching?))-randomized unique weapons (you will more then likely main a autosniper that uses pistol ammo if you find one like I did(didnt make sense but I rolled with it))-this game will make you make tough decisions (spent 15 mins deciding weither i needed an rpg with one shot or my ammo for my main weapon(dont you ♥♥♥♥ing judge me!!!))

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
y 1, 2011
												Perhaps my favorite PC game as of this writing (and 4th favorite game of all time!), Shadow of Chernobyl crafts a world where terror and violence lurks in the irradiated grasslands and the seemingly-empty shells of civilization that make up the Exclusion Zone. With its consistently bleak atmosphere, minimalist sound design, and horrifying monsters, S.T.A.L.K.E.R.:SoC has given me more lasting nightmares and sudden screams than other games that actually try really hard to scare you. Players who persevere through the initially high learning curve and generally bug-riddled nature of Eastern European games will find that SoC isn’t a mere FPS with RPG elements, but a whole new experience in its own right.

content:
er 26, 2013
												Has some of the best atmosphere in a game, as well as a great persistent world. You can often just randomly stumble across groups of dudes fighting each other, or even animals chasing and fighting each other. The game doesn't hold your hand at all, and makes you feel like you are in this messed up apocolyptic radioactive hell along with a bunch of other guys, many of which either want to kill you or exploit you.If it's your first time playing, look for the Zone Reclamation Project, as it fixes up the bugs in the game, without nerfing the gameplay like the Complete mod does. Look at the AMK mod for subsequent playthroughs, and if you are batshit insane, look at Narodnaya Soljanka.

content:
2, 2014
												Before the Metro 2033 games came out, all of us post-apocalyptic Eastern Europe fans had only the books and S.T.A.L.K.E.R. Personally, I prefer this series over Metro, due to it being centered more around the original Chernobyl NPP catastrophe. While being a FPS, it has touches of RPG in it, as opposed to Metro's strict adventure FPS. It's a bit of a diamond in the rough compared to its prequel and sequel, but the S.T.A.L.K.E.R. series still stands out strong and proud. Just be sure you're not drunk enough to not know your basic geography. We don't take too kindly to that.

												Great game. Challanging. The graphics, compared to new standards, are decent. but the story line is one of the best i've seen for a single player fps. You start off with minimal gear and have to fight to get the gear you need to survive later on; you need to base your gear on the way you play. wreckless, charge in, bullets flyin, gettin shot in the ♥♥♥, smg/light armor/light gear to careful, strategy oriented assault rifle, medium or heavier armor n gear. you gotta be aware of hunger, etc. The game is a well thought out mystery/fps. choose sides, time limited side goals while still trying to complete the main goal of figurin out who the hell you are and wtf happen. Bought a bundle (Shadow of Cher. & Call of Pripyat) around $10 or so. have yet to be disappointed....except now i got windows 8/8.1, having a bit of an issue setting my options up (graphics) for my screen res, etc. But the series is definitely worth looking up!!!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
ry 14, 2014
												One of the most atmospheric shooters, and holds itself well despite being way old.  Be sure to update the core game with Stalker Complete mods (cleans up most of the minor but annoying bugs from vanilla).  A game that challenges you to shoot straight and use cover; run & gun will only get you as far as the "load game" screen.  An environment that tries to intimidate and injure you throughout the game (and does a very fine job of it).  Turn down the lights, put on some good headphones and just absorb the atmosphere.  One of the few games that I played that I had an AN-94 with grenade launcher and scope, a desert eagle, an MP5, 6 grenades, 500 rounds of ammo, and I was STILL hesitant to leave a safe area in the dark.  A must-buy for any single player FPS fan.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
y 25, 2015
												When someone asks "which is the best FPS you've ever played?" It's a difficult question to answer, but I can easily that STALKER SOC is the best FPS I've played in the last 10 years. The RPG elements, inventory management and the sandbox environment add a lot of depth to the game and the atmosphere is just brilliant. The exclusion zone is beautifully created and the bleak atmosphere is captured well. There are plenty of weapons, not weapons different because of stats but different unique weapons that can be modified with a scope or a grenade launcher. Artifacts can be collected and used for additional stats like protection against radation or bullets.      "You kill two blood suckers and your health is down and the screen stars to swim and that moment of dread when you realise that a controller is nearby!" that's horror!      I'm playing the Pripyat mission in the night looking for the secret lab and it was so brilliant that I had to pause the game and come here to write a review. Please, I mean PLEASE do yourself a favor and pick this game up!!!!!!!!!

content:
5, 2016
												Kind of a blend of the old and new Fallout games, with a grittier, scaryier, and more difficult world.I warn you, this game may be frustratingly difficult sometimes in the early game. It takes some time to learn how to do well. And getting some better weapons helps too. That said, use cover. Aim for the head, or legs as most humans wear body armor of some kind. Body shots are next to worthless. Once you get used to how to survive and fight effectvely, the game really takes off. The setting is grim in a way that reminds me a lot of metro, and the isometric fallouts. The lore and information introduced in the game's encyclepedia is not only interesting but vitally useful as well. This is the ONLY game I've ever played where reading the ingame lore compendium or encyclepedia entries as they unlock is rewarding! Enemies are challenging and frighteing, especially when you encounter new mutants that you don't know much about. You have to be aware of your environment when fighting so you don't back-pedal into a lethal anomaly or radiation patch.Only 10 is hours in but I am loving the adventure of this game. It has kind of an old style charm, like morrowind, but is very viable as a modern game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
1, 2014
												I absolutely adore this game. For whatever reason it was one of my earliest Steam purchases, and really set a precedent for me. I'm probably one of the few people left that plays this game without mods/vanilla, and I'm always hesitant to install them. This game was my Dark Souls many years earlier. It is brutal and unforgiving and really takes an understanding of what is happening around you so that you can eventually feel like you are actually a powerful force in the world you inhabit and deserve to be as such. Hauntingly beatiful and deathly terrifying, I'd recommend this game to anyone who enjoys difficult atmospheric shooters (think early Metro 2033/Last Light with more outdoors settings). It has been a long time since I've had to learn and pay attention as much in a game as in this one, and I'll forever revel in it as it holds a special place in my heart. The following games advance in different directions but still afford notice, I've only played its prequel and not the sequel so I can't make particular recommendations there. If you like what you've heard here, and want to pick up an extremely interesting game that it would be hard to spend more than $20 on, heed my advice and go for it8/10

content:
, 2014
												It's S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl and it's one of the best first person shooters of all time. This game has it all with the rough characters that are earthy and simple, the huge amount of inventory that's available and of course don't bring back everything you can to the trader for extra cash because you're simply going to have a huge pile of gear in the ship or near your locker and then the game slows down because you brought back thousands of extra handguns, knives, ammo and whatever and then tossed them in the corner. If you do that then spread them around outside because the game get's unstable with thousands of weapons and stuff tossed in the corner of a room. Trust me you don't want to do that because the game doesn't like it but otherwise this game is solid, fun, kewl, awesome and it gets very creepy, moody, spooky and full of pressure and tight suspense. There's a lot to risk and a lot to think about and the more you play the more you want to play more. This game needs the mods from MODdb and after that you're set and ready to play. The MODS there will stabilize the game, tweak the graphics, add some gear and make everything operate better and more stable. Buy it because it's sooper and buy S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat too because it' simply awesome too. The other STALKER Clear Sky I've not played much and it seems different and so I didn't find the extra time because I have 48 shooter games ;) Buy S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Call of Pripyat and buy S.T.A.L.K.E.R.: Shadow of Chernobyl because these are the best in the series and both have great support at MODdb and you'll love the trippy weirdness of the game that is 100% a full on first person shooter experience with some really kewl other stuff to do too. Great games.

There's no upgrading or repairing in this version, but mods will be able to change that. content:
9, 2014
												This game may not be for everyone. S.T.A.L.K.E.R. may seem dated when compared to modern shooters it does have what most lack, interesting mechanics  and immersion that you can really sink your teeth into. Can't really even say I've played anything else like it. The world of this game feels alive and really captures the hoplessness seems to permeate Russian fiction. This game, while not perfect, offers some of the most immersive moments I've ever hadA lot of people recomend going into this game modless but I have to disagree. Currently playing with autumn aurora 2 and it's amazing without sacrificing the original feel of the game.Pros:+ Immersion that is so deep, you could drown.+ Interesting locations and content+ Firefights are intense, especially if you have a gun that is prone to jamming.Cons:- Story can be ho hum at points- A.I. can be a little unfair at times- Difficulty spikes throughout the game (for the love of god bring lots of ammo)Overall:At the start of my second play through I ran away from a pack of dogs...into a military squadren. Dodging bullets, I sprinted back to the first HQ which started a firefight between the military and stalkers. I hid in an abondanded house, while a quest giving npc caught a bullet with his face and died. I failed the "quests" he gave me but I got to scavenge his body and took his guns and money. All of this was unscripted.9/Roadside Picnic would highly recommend.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
3, 2016
												This game is great. While the graphics are definitely not perfect, they aren't bad either. They give a more than good enough view of the landscape and surroundings, but I'm not here to just talk about that. The feel of this game is spot on for the lore that they are trying to give. The firefights are tense and challenging, and extremely rewarding when you come out on top, especially in the beginning when they hand you trash and tell you to take out groups of bandits. This feeling does fade some when you move to more effective equipment, but its still a rush to get into shooting matches with enemies. The mechanics are really good as well. They work well, and while this game is not necessarily a first point survival game, the elements are worked in very well, such as hunger, bleeding, and radiation. Overall, this is a very good game, which I would recommend to anyone that likes challenges in shooters, or at least not having running and gunning to be the best strategy. You have to play smart to live through these fights. One thing I would like to point out though, is that to really make this game stellar, the S.T.A.L.K.E.R. Complete mod should be installed. It just takes everything, and makes it feel more finished than it already is. Slightly smoothed and adjusted textures, adjusted names from game names to real names for weapons, items and the like. Stuff like that. It just makes an already good game great.

content:

												One of the best games I have ever played, simply due to the such realistic and heart destroying atmoshpere that is presnt within the game. Its inventory system is good and unique to the player as well as a vast array of weapons to choose from. The A-Life system within this game although old is still a masterpiece with animals and mutants behaving as they should and would if it were real life. content:
1, 2015
												Strongly recommended.I first bought the game media DVD days after it was relased and reached my region... however, due to various reasons, I could not play it until now... those reasons were mainly language barrier (not native English, or good English at that time), so I could not understand much of the game back then... also my first encounter of the bloodsucker :D it made me jump on my seat... (I'll never forget that moment :D), so I thought: this is not the right time to play this game...I kept it in the shelve collecting dust, ignoring it, and I thought I wasted my money on it...Now, I got it on steam, and finally I could understand English well, so I thought, why not give it a try and see what is this game really is?I installed the 3 games, and started with SoC 2 weeks ago, and I just finished it...This game is now my number one game and I loved every single moment of it while I was playing... I lived with the main character through every single corner and place of it, and I will not forget my time playing this game...I will replay it, and I will make different choices through the game, again and again... I will not get bored of it I'm sure of this...This game has everything, RPG (of course), action, horror, mysteries, stealth and sneaking, and even some drama...This series (the 3 games Shadow of Chernobyl, Clear Sky, and Call of Pripyat), made me feel really sad for that there will be no STALKER II of it... and I really hope that a day will come and I see this got a "II" after its name...I definately recommend this to every single gamer who want adventure and all types of game play mixed in 1 game...This should get more hype and more known over some "big" titles out there.

content:
ry 23, 2016
												Lets get some things out of the way -this game is not a twich shooter its gunplay is more similar to arma than CoD (which may be a dealbreaker for some)-you are slow and lumbering plus the lack of fast travel makes going back and forth between quests somewhat boring and monotonous -without spoiling anything the ending came out of nowhere (I was halfway expecting to be pulled back into the game after the credits)-there is no skills progression and base level weapons are still effective at end game if used properly -there are odd difficulty spikes when the rng nature of openents weapons and equipment rolls against you -game is not fully voiced in english (understandable given its Ukrainian developers-enemy AI has dificulty tracking moving targets (you can really hit them while running so its not game breaking)-you will die... alot (F6 quicksave F7 load last save)with those points out of the way I would like to say why I recomend this game-the skill based gunplay feels intuitive and fun -game is dufficult and unforgiving but fair-game builds up tension like nothing youve ever seen due to its fantastic lighting and sound design -I like to think of myself as being hard to scare but this game manages to -HEADSOTS ARE INSAKILL (for you and enemy keep that in mind when your questioning why you got oneshoted)-interesting faction and npc relationship system with every npc in game (shoot out a bandits legs but let him live and that same guy might save you in the future unless he gets eaten by wild dogs)-game will let you fail quests (essential ones will have to be completed some other way(branching?))-randomized unique weapons (you will more then likely main a autosniper that uses pistol ammo if you find one like I did(didnt make sense but I rolled with it))-this game will make you make tough decisions (spent 15 mins deciding weither i needed an rpg with one shot or my ammo for my main weapon(dont you ♥♥♥♥ing judge me!!!))

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
, 2016
												"KILL STRELOK"I never thought a sense of grinding dread would be a good thing in a game, but STALKER pulls off its atmosphere like no other game. Chernobyl's "Zone" is a bleak, dangerous land full of adventurers, opportunists, wonders, and mutants. Death is around every corner, and the game can be brutally hard at times. Still, the desire to explore this wasteland and meet the people and factions who call it home hooks you in. The story is nothing amazing, but it does make you want to know more about what's really going on.Playing the game is like an emotional rollercoaster. You'll be scared when exploring a derelict lab full of God-knows-what, relieved when you make it back safely to a friendly settlement, and happy when you have enough rubles to buy that shiny new gun from a trader. While technically not a post-apocalyptic game, STALKER has the best wasteland I've ever seen. One needs to be sharp and resourceful to make it in the Zone. Ammo has weight, and the carrying weight is low. You can't lug around twelve different guns and fifty thousand bullets. You pick up what's absolutely needed, maybe a thing or two that you can sell to a trader, and that is it. Sorry RPG-7, but you're not worth dropping a bunch of 5.45x39 ammunition nor medical supplies for. Knowing when to pick your fights is key, as every engagement has you using valuable ammo and meds, neither of which you seem to have enough of. Even with the best weapons and armor in the game, the Zone can still take your life before you know it.I would recommend first playing SoC with the Zone Reclamation Project mod which fixes many bugs in the vanilla game. Also, a mod that allows you to repair weapons/armor would be handy. STALKER SoC features unique weapons/armor and item degradation, but no way to repair them in the vanilla game. There's graphics mods as well if the vanilla game looks too dated. After that, go crazy. STALKER has more total conversion mods than any other game I've seen. It's like a different game every time you play. Also look into the expansions, Clear Sky and Call of Pripyat, which further refine and build upon the experience in this game.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
24, 2014
												S.T.A.L.K.E.R Shadow of Chernobyl is a single player, survival horror, open world, RPG. It is set in the year 2012 six years after the second CNPP explosion in what is none as The Zone of Alienation. The 60 Kilometer Exclusionusion Zone established around the CNPP. You are one of the many S.T.A.L.K.E.Rs that roam The Zone in search of valuable artifacts spawned by strange anomalies that seem to defy science. The game is quite difficult when you start off but as you progress you're given access to more powerful gear like tactical hazmat suits and exoskeletons. The controls are like any other FPS and easy to get the hang of. The survival aspect of the game is the need to eat, scavenge for medical supplies like anti-rad meds and bandages to stop bleeding, and searching for ammo and weapons. The atmosphere in the game is amazing. The first time I encountered a Bloodsucker, I nearly jumped out of my seat. One mission had me explore an abandoned laboratory that was crawling with mutants and ghosts. I couldn't go more than 10 feet without freezing from fear. I stood in one room for about five minutes straight, afraid to move and face whatever horrors lay deep within. Like most RPGs, there are side missions. They're okay for the most part. But after a while it gets a little repetitive with most missions being, go and kill this bandit, or go destroy a pack of mutants. But the rewards make it worth your time. There's a large number of weapons available in the game but most of them won't become accessible till you're at least halfway through the game. The game, minus side missions, should last you about a good 40 hours. But I highly recommend doing the side missions for extra money. Seeing as how most weapons and armor are expensive and trust me, you are gonna need good armor and weapons. Especially towards the end of the game. Now, the game does have a fair number of bugs. Most of which you can fix by installing mods like the S.T.A.L.K.E.R Complete mod which not only fixes bugs, but improves the graphics as well. The default graphics in the game are pretty decent for their time, but I still highly recommend playing with mods like Absolute Nature and Sharers Max. Final verdict: 9.5/10 The game is amazing unless you come across one of the rare game breaking bugs. My only other complaint with is that there wasn't much pressure to go out and explore. Most of the time I was simply going from mission to mission. Apart from those two problems, the game is phenomenal. I highly recommend playing it.

content:
ry 12, 2014
												The word that can best describe this game is 'gritty'.I've beat it twice now, which makes me barely an amateur. The first time I didn't invest into the story and barely scrapped by the (suddenly very difficult) end game area. I didn't see it much more than an FPS with more stats to worry about, so I uninstalled it.Years later I gave it another try, but instead invested more into the story and gameplay, and I ended up really liking what the game did offer. STALKER definitely offers a unique 'gritty' experience that many other games won't ever aim for. Its a neat cross between something you would see in a more realistic tactical shooter, but has some of the exploration elements that you would see in more open-world games. Definitely worth checking out.

content:
8, 2014
												In my opinion, this is one of the all time greats of PC gaming; a true work of genius.  Not only is it a fantastic horror-themed game, but it also sports one of the best gun-based combat engines I've ever used in any game.  But I think what I like the best about the game are the incredible atmospherics.  Between the vast swaths of abandoned structures that you can explore, and the wonderful dynamic weather system, Stalker is a game that truly and deeply immerses you in a terrifying alternate reality.  Truly, I cannot say enough about this bona fide classic.  PS:  And don't let its age scare you away.  Get the easy to install Stalker Complete mod, and this game looks and runs just fine on a modern rig.  Also, be sure to read Roadside Picnic, and watch the movie Stalker, for a better idea of the origins of the Zone.

The atmosphere, the sound effects, the enemies all make this game feel a dynamic trip to the remains of Earth's worst nuclear disaster. However your weapons are like peashooters, and some of your enemies are ridiculously strong for example, in the sarcophagus of the reactor it feels like the Monolith are using anti-tank rounds because it's a near one shot kill for them.. number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
, 2015
												Shadow of Chernobyl is a fun and expansive game set in "The Zone", an area of Ukraine that was directly affected by the Chernobyl Plant disaster. With that out of the way, I'd like to get down to why this game is so incredible. Atmosphere. You wont find a game that pulls you in and holds you there quite like a Stalker game. The game has a way of simply including you in the zone, making you feel as if every encounter is life or death and the moments in between are a sweet breath of fresh air. I tell you, there's nothing like coming in from the clustering darkness to an old railway station after fighting off hordes of obnoxiously intelligent (and I'm being serious, STALKER ai is frightening to fight against, and is rumored to be able to complete the game on their own) bandits to find a group of fellow Stalkers and rookies huddled around a trashcan fire, speaking softly in Russian, knowing in here, around friends, just for tonight- You're safe.Shootouts are frequent and heart pounding. It's recommended you play on Master difficulty with the crosshairs disabled. You and your target are likely to go down in a few hits. As I said before, the Ai is frighteningly intelligent. They will actively move towards you if they can, flanking and moving from cover to cover, plunking shots all the while. This makes choosing your cover very important, and forces you to keep a close eye on who your fighting with. All too often I've damn near ♥♥♥♥ myself because I let a bandit come up behind me while I was trading shots with a few of his buddies in a run down far. Speaking of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ oneself, The Zone is not only populated with bandits, but monsters as well, all of them designed and built around fear.STALKER is an RPG of sorts. You've got an inventory system, weight system, you need to eat every so often, there's an economy, weapons and armor to pick from, factions and reputation- It's got it all. Will I tell you it's done well? Not all of it. Don't expect to level up or pick our perks. That can somewhat be accomplished by recovering artifacts, but it's certainly not the same. Still, that's no reason to not check out the game. STALKER in the end is a fun and terrifying game, one that makes you feel like a rugged post-apocalyptic Ukranian artifact hunter and full time bandit/creature slayer. Shadow of Chernobyl comes highly recommended, and once you've done a vanilla play through, there's an abundance of mods to try out. Then go on to pick up CS and Call of Pripyat. Good hunting, Stalkers.

y 4, 2012
												This s probably one of the most amazing FPS i have ever played, yes it has its bugs like "multiple spawns" NPCs without collision,one or two missions broken..The atmosphere is fantastic and unlike any other game out there. it was in development for years and even though they didn't manage to include everything they wanted, what they did is still incredible. this is no Console shooter or port, if you want a simple run and gun don't buy it and play for 20 minutes and complain when unlike Crysis you can't kill everything in 10 seconds with your hitech gun and invincible p0ssy suit.,Gameplay is about doing quests, roaming around the Chernobyl zone, avoiding deadly "anomalies" and radiactive area and battling with bandits, military, mutants and aggressive wildlife.Zone represent area around Chernobyl with forests, plains, city of Pripyat, nuclear plant...The game is mostly FPS but RPG elements are very strong.Models and textures are a bit outdated but light and shadows are very impressive.

content:
, 2015
												Nothing even comes close! this is as hardcore as free roam FPS's get! the story, atmospherics (oohhhh the atmospherics), the horror, the action, the stealth, the weapons (and how real they are), the suits, the creatures, the anomolies, the group dynamics... everything is perfect! EVERY DECISION YOU MAKE... EVERY DECISION... WILL AFFECT THE ENDING OF THE GAME... 12 different endings that is. Also, the sheer number of mods available for this game are nuts. the first mod you really should get is called 'complete' it just basically updates all the textures to a higher resolution and fixes a few other 2006ish issues.If i had to pick a con... just one tiny con... the lack of hand to hand combat. nope you dont get a knife, so if you run out of bullets, well then youre kinda screwed. but the chances of that happening are freakishly low though.

The atmosphere outshines all the graphical problems. You'll be damned to experience the feeling of being back into society than when you arrive back to the bar after a long day hunting. The final run onto the CNPP and the 7 endings will challenge conventional FPS abities that have been dormant since the first Far Cry. The music, between MooZe's atmospheric score and Firelake's action music will set in more than just fear, proving this superior to an ordinary horror game. Thiis is Fallout 3 and the kictchen sink. Few games have made me more relieved to find an AI controlled ally when I'm low on health. Also what other game allows you to steal a gun from a dead Gordon Freeman?10/10

content:
er 18, 2014
												One of the greatest games i have ever played. 11/10Do not let the relese date fool you. S.T.A.L.K.E.R was ahead of its time back then.The atmosphere and sence of exploration is (how should i put it) UNIQUE. To me there is only a handful of games that have this level of immersion.The game feels like you are really there in that world. The fear of danger and environment is transferred to the player.Now that is in my opinion what games should be about: taking you into another world completely.A note of warning: This game would be considered   HARD  by today's standards. Do not expect INSTA-FUN without effort, like in games you see out there today. It does not feel like, look like or "taste" like new ultra block buster titles. Your first mission  will be the hardest one.  Do not give up hope.  If you complete it, you will be able to complete the game. It may feel like you don't know what you are doing or playing at first. Do not worry it takes more time to get a hold of things. A lot of people out there say that there are a lot of bugs. Not sure what they are talking about. I didnt have any. Except those "normal" ones you would find in any other game.Oh and: SAFE containers are only in the merchant locations!

content:
4, 2016
												This game is an enigma for me. Russian 'end of the world' stories all seem to revolve around 'bombs drop, we all die... yet we don't all die. Mutants attack, weird anomolys pop up... we have to survive in this nightmare.' Now in this game it's not the end of the world, only the area around Chernobyl.The game is rife with interesting options for ways to kill people. There are some systems in the game that don't really effect gameplay as much as you'd expect (factions for instance... you can pretty much fight whomever you want/can kill... instead of spending weeks farming faction lol). Stealth is by far better rewarded than in most games, but you can still take the 'RAMBO MUTHA F*(&&*%*&%ERS!' approach, but be prepared to get lit up if you are outgunned. The mutants are pretty interested and surprising, and the anomolies can really make the landscape alive... in more ways than one.There is some minor RPG elements with the way gear works, but honestly once you get the hang of it you can pretty much get your hero up to insane levels of power and plow through targets with little effort, just have to spend time getting the right rocks... so to speak.Graphically the game is a bit dated, but the gameplay holds up. If you want a nice open world feel for a nightmare... by all means get this game. If you get stuck (Learning curve can be a bit rough) look up one of the hundreds of guides out there to give you a hand.
